channel.title: Indexes on KhanhIceTea B(rain)-log
channel.description: Recent content in Indexes on KhanhIceTea B(rain)-log

item.title: What I learned in 2017-10-13
item.description: DATABASE Indexes on multiple columns Let’s say you have an indexes on 2 columns (A, B) of the table (X). So this is three use cases happen : You query data based on both of 2 columns => Indexes will be considered You query data based on (A) => Indexes will be considered You query data based on (B) => Indexes will be ignored because database indexes your data by B-tree algo.
